Activity 2: Data Exploration - **Task:** Use the following R-code output to calculate the sample mean and standard deviation, then infer the shape, mean, and spread of the population and sampling distribution. ::: {.cell} ```{webr} #| echo: true data_vector <- c( 2, 3, 8, 6, 4, 4, 6, 4, 2, 5, 8, 10, 4, 4, 4, 2, 1, 3, 2, 10, 1, 3, 2, 3, 4, 3, 5, 2, 4, 1, 2, 9, 1, 7, 17, 9, 9, 9, 4, 4, 1, 1, 1, 3, 1, 6, 3, 3, 2, 5, 1, 3, 3, 14, 2, 3, 9, 6, 6, 3, 5, 1, 4, 6, 11, 22, 1, 9, 6, 5, 2, 2, 5, 4, 3, 6, 1, 5, 1, 6, 17, 1, 2, 4, 5, 4, 4, 3, 2, 3, 3, 5, 2, 3, 3, 2, 10, 2, 4, 2 ) mean(data_vector) #xbar sd(data_vector) #s ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{webr} # Plot histogram of the original data hist(data_vector, main = "Histogram of Population Data", col = "skyblue", border = "black") set.seed(123) # Ensure reproducibility # Sampling parameters n_samples <- 1000 # Number of samples sample_size <- 100 # Size of each sample # Generate sample means using map sample_means <- map_dbl(1:n_samples, ~mean(sample(data_vector, sample_size, replace = TRUE))) # Compute statistics mean_sample <- mean(sample_means) sd_sample <- sd(sample_means) # Plot the density of the sample means ggplot(data.frame(sample_means), aes(x = sample_means)) + geom_histogram(aes(y = after_stat(density)), bins = 30, fill = "lightblue", color = "black", alpha = 0.6) + geom_density(color = "red", size = 1) + geom_vline(xintercept = mean_sample, linetype = "dashed", color = "blue", linewidth = 1) + annotate("text", x = mean_sample, y = 0.15, label = paste0("Mean: ", round(mean_sample, 2)), color = "blue") + annotate("text", x = mean_sample + sd_sample, y = 0.13, label = paste0("SD: ", round(sd_sample, 2)), color = "darkgreen") + labs(title = "Sampling Distribution of Sample Means", x = "Sample Means", y = "Density") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: ## Activity 3: Understanding Confidence Intervals ![Confidence Intervals](images/Day19-5.png){ width=50% } ![100(1-$\alpha$) CI](images/Day19-6.png){ width=100% } ![90% CI](images/Day19-7.png){ width=100% } What is the correct interpretation of $100(1-\alpha)\%$ confidence intervals for a mean of a population? \vspace*{1in} ## Activity 4: Group Activities with Real Data - **Task:** Using the provided dataset in Activity 2, calculate a 95% confidence interval for the population mean $\mu$. Interpret the results in the context of the problem. \vspace*{1in} ## Activity 5: Case Studies and Problem-Solving - **Case Study:** A hospital wants to estimate the average length of stay for its patients. They have collected data from 30 patients and found a sample mean of 5 days with a standard deviation of 5 days. Calculate a 95% confidence interval for the average length of stay and interpret the results. Use the interval estimator $\bar{x} \pm 1.96 \sigma_{\bar{x}}$ to calculate a confidence interval for the target parameter, $\mu$.
